reviewText:
Early Access Review

Action RPG mixed with Bejeweled... Enough said. Buy it now!

It even has a multiplayer arena with rankings/leaderboards!

This game has taken me by surprise! I had no idea it was coming out or what it was. 2 minutes after it launched EA, I read the description, bought it on a whim, and I must say, this is insane! Only 8.99? Deal of the century!
voteText: 10 of 13 people (77%) found this review helpful 2 people found this review funny

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Surprisingly intense - kind of Puzzle Quest TURBO. Rather than match 3,  you match as many as possible. The top half of the screen is a fully animated action battle that shows the results of your matches and ability uses. Full armor/weapon drops, spell upgrades- this game is really great, actually.

PvP seems sparsely populated, but this is day 1 of early access so that's not a genuine knock at this point. Still, even ranked pvp gives the option (when it doesn't find a human opponent) to fight the 'shadow' of the real player (basically AI that imitates that player's behaviour).

Big thumbs up from me, but I am admittedly a sucker for the genre.
voteText: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If you played and loved puzzle quest, you'd be crazy to pass this one up.

This game only adds to the brilliant puzle quest formula and is by no means a rip off.  It has enough of it's own original ideas to make it feel fresh and fun to play.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nReally great game if you like puzzle & RPG. Its like puzzle quest in the real time.  The only issue for me is the game need steam always connected to the internet which I can't do all the time. Hope single player campaign can be played offline.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nAlthough not a huge match 3/match fan, this game has got enough gameplay and customizations, such as the shop, unlockable spells, equipment, crafting, and multiplayer leaderboards, to pique my interest.  For those wanting to see some first impressions, I did a quick gameplay video going in completely blind with a first play and playing a couple of levels.  Video is in full 1440p.  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sTzcsDA1mvA&

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nExcellent Puzzle Quest Action RPG mash-up game.  Polished graphics, colorful presentation, good progression, it's all there. Nice work, Outsmart.  Keep up the great work!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is OK, but nothing great.
Its biggest problem is f2p roots. It feels in the slow progression and tiny rewards. The gameplay is repetitive and quickly became boring.

Rather than grinding through hundreds of identical enemies in BloodGate, I recommend to check out the classic Puzzle Quest.
